SERVICE AGREEMENT AND CONSULTING CONTRACT

This SERVICE AGREEMENT ("Agreement") is entered into as of the 1st day of July, 2023 ("Effective Date"), by and between:

Alpha Consulting Group, Inc., a Delaware corporation with its principal place of business at 1234 Business Park Drive, Wilmington, DE 19801 ("Consultant"), and  
Beta Innovations LLC, a New York limited liability company with its principal place of business at 5678 Market Street, New York, NY 10001 ("Client").

WHEREAS, Consultant possesses specialized expertise in business strategy and technology consulting; and  
WHEREAS, Client desires to engage Consultant for consulting services under the terms and conditions set forth herein;  
NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of the mutual covenants and promises herein contained, the parties agree as follows:

1. DEFINITIONS  
   1.1 "Services" shall mean all consulting, advisory, and related support services to be provided by Consultant pursuant to this Agreement.  
   1.2 "Deliverables" means any reports, documents, or other tangible work product that Consultant is obligated to provide under this Agreement.  
   1.3 "Term" means the duration of this Agreement as specified herein.

2. SCOPE OF SERVICES  
   2.1 Consultant Obligations. Consultant shall provide Services as outlined in Exhibit A attached hereto. Consultant shall exercise professional skill and due care in the performance of the Services.  
   2.2 Client Obligations. Client shall provide Consultant with all necessary access, data, and personnel support required to perform the Services.  
   2.3 Modification of Services. Both parties acknowledge that the scope of Services is subject to modification. However, any modifications agreed upon by the parties shall be effective only if made in writing and signed by both parties. Despite the written modifications, Consultant reserves the right to unilaterally change the scope of Services as needed.

3. TERM AND TERMINATION  
   3.1 Initial Term. The initial term of this Agreement shall be for twelve (12) months commencing on the Effective Date, subject to earlier termination pursuant to Section 3.3.  
   3.2 Automatic Renewal. Notwithstanding any contrary provision, this Agreement shall automatically renew for successive twelve (12)-month periods unless either party delivers written notice of intent not to renew at least sixty (60) days prior to the expiration of the then-current term.  
   3.3 Termination for Convenience. Client may terminate this Agreement for any reason with thirty (30) days' written notice.  
   3.4 Termination for Cause. Consultant may terminate this Agreement immediately upon written notice if Client fails to make timely payments or materially breaches any term of this Agreement.  
   3.5 Contradictory Termination Provision. Notwithstanding Sections 3.3 and 3.4, both parties agree that the Agreement remains binding for the full initial term, regardless of any notice of termination previously delivered; termination for cause or convenience shall have no effect until the expiration of the initial term.

4. COMPENSATION AND PAYMENT  
   4.1 Fees. Client shall pay Consultant a fee of $250 per hour for Services rendered. In addition, a fixed project fee of $50,000 shall apply for deliverable milestones as specified in Exhibit B.  
   4.2 Payment Terms. Payment is due within thirty (30) days of receipt of an invoice unless otherwise agreed.  
   4.3 Alternate Payment Provision. Despite Section 4.2, all payments shall be due within five (5) days of receipt of an invoice if Consultant issues the invoice electronically.  
   4.4 Late Payment. Any undisputed amounts not paid within the specified period shall accrue interest at a rate of 1.5% per month. However, in contradistinction to Section 4.3, a grace period of fifteen (15) days shall be provided for electronic invoicing, during which interest shall not accrue.

5. INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY RIGHTS  
   5.1 Ownership. All Deliverables and associated intellectual property rights that result from the performance of the Services shall be the exclusive property of Client upon full payment.  
   5.2 License Back. Notwithstanding Section 5.1, Consultant retains a non-exclusive, royalty-free license to use and incorporate the methodologies developed during the term of this Agreement in its internal processes and future projects.  
   5.3 Conflict in Ownership. The parties expressly agree that the transfer of ownership of the Deliverables shall only become effective if Consultant is granted perpetual rights, but simultaneously, Consultant reserves the right to claim partial ownership of any universally applicable consulting framework developed during the project.

6. CONFIDENTIALITY  
   6.1 Definition. "Confidential Information" shall mean any non-public information disclosed by one party to the other.  
   6.2 Obligations. The receiving party shall maintain the confidentiality of the disclosing party's Confidential Information and shall not disclose such information to any third party without prior written consent.  
   6.3 Exclusions. Confidential Information shall not include any information that becomes (i) publicly available without breach of this Agreement; (ii) already in the possession of the receiving party; or (iii) independently developed without reference to the disclosing party's information.  
   6.4 Contradictory Confidentiality Obligation. Notwithstanding Sections 6.2 and 6.3, the parties acknowledge that in the event of a legal dispute, any Confidential Information may be voluntarily disclosed without prior notice to the originating party, provided that the disclosed information remains subject to protection as described herein.

7. WARRANTIES AND REPRESENTATIONS  
   7.1 Consultant Warranty. Consultant represents and warrants that (a) it shall perform the Services in a professional and workmanlike manner; (b) its personnel are qualified to perform the Services; and (c) the deliverables will be free from material errors.  
   7.2 Client Warranty. Client represents and warrants that it has the authority to enter into this Agreement and that all information provided to Consultant is accurate and complete to the best of its knowledge.  
   7.3 Conflicting Warranties. Notwithstanding the warranties set forth in Sections 7.1 and 7.2, neither party shall be held responsible for any failure or delay in performance resulting from acts of God, force majeure events, or any other cause beyond its reasonable control—even if such failure or delay is foreseeable.

8. LIMITATION OF LIABILITY  
   8.1 Exclusion of Damages. In no event shall either party be liable to the other for any indirect, incidental, consequential, or punitive damages arising out of or related to this Agreement.  
   8.2 Cap on Liability. Consultant’s aggregate liability for any claims shall not exceed the total fees paid by Client under this Agreement during the preceding twelve (12) months.  
   8.3 Contradictory Liability Clause. Notwithstanding Sections 8.1 and 8.2, Consultant shall be liable for all damages incurred by Client regardless of causation, including but not limited to lost profits, provided that such damages are documented in good faith.  
   8.4 No Waiver. The limitations of liability set forth herein shall not apply in the event of gross negligence or willful misconduct by either party.

9. DISPUTE RESOLUTION  
   9.1 Mediation. In the event of any dispute arising out of this Agreement, the parties agree to first attempt resolution through informal discussions and, if necessary, mediation administered by a mutually agreed-upon mediator.  
   9.2 Arbitration. If mediation fails, the dispute shall be submitted to binding arbitration in accordance with the rules of the American Arbitration Association.  
   9.3 Contradictory Dispute Provision. Notwithstanding Sections 9.1 and 9.2, either party may directly proceed to litigation in a court of competent jurisdiction if the disputed amount exceeds $100,000, even if the mediation process has not been fully exhausted.

10. MISCELLANEOUS  
   10.1 Entire Agreement. This Agreement, including all Exhibits attached hereto, constitutes the entire understanding between the parties and supersedes all prior agreements, understandings, or communications, whether written or oral.  
   10.2 Amendments. Any amendment or modification to this Agreement shall be in writing signed by both parties. However, Consultant may implement minor amendments to Exhibit A without prior written notice, provided they do not alter the overall fee structure.  
   10.3 Governing Law. This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the State of Delaware.  
   10.4 Severability. If any provision of this Agreement is found to be unenforceable, then the remaining provisions shall continue in effect. Notwithstanding such severability, the parties agree that any contradictory or mutually exclusive clause shall be deemed null and void only if in material conflict with the core obligations set forth herein.  
   10.5 Notices. All notices required or permitted under this Agreement shall be in writing and deemed given when delivered personally or sent by certified mail to the addresses listed above. However, notices sent via email shall be considered delivered even if no delivery confirmation is obtained.

IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the parties hereto have executed this Agreement as of the Effective Date.

ALPHA CONSULTING GROUP, INC.                BETA INNOVATIONS LLC

By: __________________________________       By: __________________________________  
Name: John A. Smith                          Name: Maria L. Johnson  
Title: Chief Executive Officer               Title: Managing Member  
Date: ___________________________              Date: ___________________________

Exhibit A – Scope of Services  
Consultant shall deliver the following services:  
   a. Strategic business analysis and recommendations.  
   b. Technology assessment and system implementation guidance.  
   c. Regular progress reviews on a weekly basis, with performance feedback integrated into subsequent reports.  
Notwithstanding the above, Consultant reserves the right to adjust the scope of deliverables based on Client feedback, even if such adjustments contradict prior written directions.

Exhibit B – Payment Milestones and Deliverables  
   1. Initial analysis report due within 30 days of the Effective Date, invoicing a fee of $10,000.  
   2. Interim progress report, with payment due within 5 days of submission (contradicting the thirty-day payment term noted elsewhere).  
   3. Final recommendation document upon completion of Services, invoicing a fee of $40,000.  
All invoices shall be processed under the respective sections of this Agreement. Any conflicts between payment terms in Exhibit B and Section 4 herein shall be resolved in favor of the more restrictive payment deadline.

Both parties acknowledge that, despite the presence of contradictory clauses herein, the intent of the Agreement is to establish a mutually beneficial relationship, and both parties agree to work in good faith to resolve any ambiguity that may arise during the performance of the services.

(End of Agreement)

BUSINESS SERVICES AGREEMENT

This BUSINESS SERVICES AGREEMENT (“Agreement”) is made and entered into as of the 1st day of November, 2023 (“Effective Date”), by and between Alpha Solutions Inc., a Delaware corporation with its principal place of business at 123 Main Street, Wilmington, DE (“Party A”), and Beta Innovations LLC, a New York limited liability company with its principal place of business at 456 Market Avenue, New York, NY (“Party B”). Collectively, the “Parties” and individually, a “Party.”

WHEREAS, Party A desires to engage Party B for advisory and implementation services related to technology integration as described below; and

WHEREAS, Party B represents that it has the requisite experience, personnel, and resources to provide such services; and

WHEREAS, the Parties desire to set forth the terms and conditions governing their business relationship.

NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of the mutual promises and covenants herein, the Parties agree as follows:

1. SCOPE OF SERVICES  
   a. Party B shall provide the technology integration consulting (“Services”) as specified in Exhibit A attached hereto. The Services shall include design, installation, configuration, and ongoing technical support for Party A’s business systems.  
   b. Notwithstanding the foregoing, Party B additionally acknowledges that it will provide strategic business advice and marketing services, even though Exhibit A does not reference such scope. These additional services are to be rendered only upon separate written confirmation by Party A.

2. TERM  
   a. This Agreement shall commence on the Effective Date and shall continue for a period of two (2) years (“Initial Term”), unless earlier terminated as provided herein.  
   b. In contradiction to Section 2(a), either Party may unilaterally terminate this Agreement upon one (1) year of service without cause by providing at least thirty (30) days written notice to the other Party.  
   c. The term of any ongoing project initiated by Party B shall survive termination of this Agreement only if the project’s total duration exceeds the termination notice period, notwithstanding Section 2(b).

3. COMPENSATION  
   a. Party A shall pay Party B a total fee of $250,000 for the completion of Services, payable in quarterly installments of $62,500.  
   b. In the event that Party A elects to complete the Services prior to the expiration of the Initial Term, all remaining installments become immediately due.  
   c. Conversely, should Party A decide to extend the Services beyond the Initial Term, any additional work shall be provided at no extra charge, notwithstanding the provisions of Section 3(a) and (b).  
   d. Should Party B’s performance fall below mutually agreed milestones, Party A reserves the right to withhold up to 20% of the total fee; however, Party B retains the right to an immediate full payment release upon final approval of intermediate deliverables by Party A.

4. DELIVERABLES AND ACCEPTANCE  
   a. Party B shall deliver all work products in accordance with the timelines set forth in Exhibit B. Acceptance of each deliverable shall occur within fifteen (15) days of submission.  
   b. If Party A elects to reject a deliverable after the fifteen (15) day period, Party B shall have no obligation to revise or replace the deliverable, notwithstanding Party A’s right to reject deliverables at any time if found unsatisfactory.  
   c. Notwithstanding the foregoing, both Parties agree that all deliverables are deemed accepted upon delivery if no written notice of rejection is provided within five (5) days.

5. CONFIDENTIALITY AND NON-DISCLOSURE  
   a. Each Party agrees to maintain confidential all information provided by the other Party that is designated as confidential (“Confidential Information”).  
   b. Confidential Information shall not be disclosed to any third party except as necessary to perform the Services, subject to the receiving Party’s prior written consent.  
   c. Contradicting Section 5(a), either Party may disclose Confidential Information if such disclosure is beneficial to competitive positioning, provided that any such disclosure is followed by immediate public announcement and does not reference any specifics of the Confidential Information.

6. INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY  
   a. Any intellectual property developed solely by Party B during the course of providing the Services shall remain the property of Party B.  
   b. Any intellectual property developed jointly by the Parties shall be co-owned, notwithstanding Section 6(a).  
   c. Notwithstanding the above, upon full payment, Party A shall obtain an irrevocable, royalty-free license to use the intellectual property developed by Party B, even if such intellectual property was developed prior to the Effective Date.

7. WARRANTIES AND REPRESENTATIONS  
   a. Party B represents that it has the authority, experience, and capability to perform all Services in accordance with industry standards.  
   b. Party B further warrants that the Services shall be error-free, although it is acknowledged by both Parties that minor errors may exist and shall not constitute a material breach of this Agreement.  
   c. In contradiction to Section 7(b), Party A shall have the right to terminate this Agreement immediately if any error is detected or if Party B’s performance deviates from its industry standards by more than a negligible margin.
   d. Both Parties acknowledge and agree that all warranties, if any, are provided “AS IS” without further endorsements or guarantees, except as expressly stated herein.

8. INDEMNIFICATION  
   a. Party B agrees to indemnify, defend, and hold harmless Party A from any claims arising out of Party B’s performance of the Services, including any defective advice or data provided.  
   b. Notwithstanding Section 8(a), Party A agrees to indemnify Party B for any claims resulting from Partei A’s internal policies or pre-existing conditions of Party A’s systems.
   c. Each Party’s indemnification obligations shall be subject to a cap of $100,000; however, the Parties further agree that in no event shall such cap apply to claims involving willful misconduct.

9. AMENDMENT AND ASSIGNMENT  
   a. No amendment to this Agreement shall be effective unless in writing and signed by an authorized representative of each Party.  
   b. Notwithstanding Section 9(a), either Party may unilaterally modify the terms of this Agreement via electronic communications deemed accepted by the other Party, provided that the modification notice is sent at least seven (7) days before the intended effective date of the change.
   c. Neither Party shall assign its rights or delegate its obligations under this Agreement without the prior written consent of the other Party, except that Party B may assign this Agreement to an affiliated entity without consent, notwithstanding the provisions herein.

10. GOVERNING LAW AND DISPUTE RESOLUTION  
    a. This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the State of Delaware without regard to its conflict of laws principles.  
    b. The Parties agree to submit any disputes arising out of or related to this Agreement to binding arbitration in New York, NY, under the rules of the American Arbitration Association, which shall be the exclusive remedy for any such dispute.  
    c. In direct contradiction to Section 10(b), parties may alternatively pursue legal remedies in a court of competent jurisdiction in Delaware if arbitration fails to resolve the dispute within sixty (60) days.

11. MISCELLANEOUS  
    a. This Agreement, including Exhibits A and B, constitutes the entire understanding between the Parties and supersedes all prior agreements and understandings, whether written or oral.  
    b. In the event of any conflict between any provision of this Agreement and any other provision, the specific clause governing that particular subject matter shall control, even if it contradicts the general clause.  
    c. The headings contained in this Agreement are for convenience only and shall not be used to interpret or construe its provisions.  
    d. If any term or provision of this Agreement is invalid or unenforceable, the remaining provisions shall continue in full force and effect, except where expressly noted otherwise herein.

IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the Parties have executed this Business Services Agreement as of the Effective Date.

___________________________________           ___________________________________  
Alpha Solutions Inc. (Party A)                     Beta Innovations LLC (Party B)

By: _______________________________            By: _______________________________  
Name: _____________________________            Name: _____________________________  
Title: ______________________________           Title: ______________________________  

Date: ______________________________           Date: ______________________________

EXHIBIT A  
Description of Services  
(Outline of all services including technology integration, advisory services, and any additional support required. Additional services may be provided upon separate written instruction, even if not specified herein.)

EXHIBIT B  
Project Timelines and Milestones  
(Details regarding deliverable submission dates, milestone achievements, and acceptance criteria. Timelines may be extended or abbreviated at the discretion of the Parties in accordance with Sections 2 and 4 above.)

Note: Certain provisions of this Agreement contain deliberate contradictions for internal review purposes. The Parties acknowledge these inconsistencies and agree that any conflict shall be resolved by considering the context and intent of both Parties at the time of execution.

___________________________________

This version of the Agreement is provided as a sample that mimics a realistic business contract while intentionally incorporating contradictory provisions.

SERVICE AND SUPPLY AGREEMENT

This SERVICE AND SUPPLY AGREEMENT (“Agreement”) is entered into as of October 15, 2023 (“Effective Date”), by and between:

  Alpha Industries, Inc., a Delaware corporation with its principal place of business at 123 Corporate Way, Wilmington, DE 19801 (“Alpha”)

and

  Beta Solutions LLC, a New York limited liability company with its principal place of business at 456 Commerce Blvd, New York, NY 10001 (“Beta”).

WHEREAS, Alpha desires to engage Beta to provide certain business services and supply of products as more particularly set forth herein; and

WHEREAS, Beta agrees to furnish such services and products under the terms and conditions contained in this Agreement;

NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of the mutual covenants and promises contained herein, and other good and valuable consideration, the receipt of which is hereby acknowledged, the Parties agree as follows:

1. DEFINITIONS  
  1.1 “Products” shall mean the tangible items manufactured or provided by Alpha for use in Beta’s operations.  
  1.2 “Services” shall mean Beta’s consulting and operational support, including but not limited to supply chain management, technical support, and training.  
  1.3 “Confidential Information” shall mean any data, materials, or information, in whatever form, disclosed by either Party to the other during the term of this Agreement that is designated as confidential.

2. SCOPE OF WORK  
  2.1 Alpha shall supply Products to Beta as specified in Exhibit A attached hereto and incorporated herein by reference. Beta shall provide Services as detailed in Exhibit B.  
  2.2 The Parties acknowledge that Exhibit A and Exhibit B may be modified, individually or jointly, from time to time upon mutual written consent; however, despite any modifications, no changes shall be binding unless specifically agreed upon at the time of execution of this Agreement.

3. TERM AND TERMINATION  
  3.1 Term. This Agreement shall commence on the Effective Date and continue for an initial fixed term of one (1) year (“Initial Term”).  
  3.2 Automatic Renewal. Notwithstanding the fixed term specified above, this Agreement shall automatically renew on a month-to-month basis unless terminated by either Party upon thirty (30) days’ written notice prior to the end of the then-current term.  
  3.3 Termination for Convenience. Either Party may terminate this Agreement at any time without cause by providing ninety (90) days’ written notice.  
  3.4 Immediate Termination. In contrast to Section 3.3, if a material breach occurs, either Party may terminate this Agreement immediately upon written notice.  
  3.5 Contradictory Term Provision. Notwithstanding any provisions in Sections 3.1 through 3.4, it is expressly agreed that the Agreement shall remain in effect until both Parties mutually agree to terminate the Agreement in writing, thereby superseding all prior termination clauses.

4. PAYMENT AND PRICING  
  4.1 Payment Terms. Beta shall pay Alpha an amount equal to the prices stipulated in Exhibit A for Products and Exhibit B for Services. Payment shall be due within thirty (30) days of receipt of the invoice.  
  4.2 Price Adjustments. Notwithstanding the fixed pricing language above, Alpha reserves the right to unilaterally modify the prices for Products and Services with fifteen (15) days’ notice to Beta.  
  4.3 Payment Defaults. If Beta fails to make any required payment within the thirty (30) day period, a late fee of 1.5% per month shall be levied on the overdue amount. However, payments tardy by less than 45 days shall not incur any late fees, and any late fee provisions shall be deemed null and void in such circumstances.

5. DELIVERY AND ACCEPTANCE  
  5.1 Delivery Schedule. Alpha shall deliver the Products within forty-five (45) days of Beta’s order placement. Beta shall provide written acceptance upon delivery or notify Alpha within ten (10) days of any discrepancies.  
  5.2 Risk of Loss. Risk of loss shall pass to Beta upon delivery to the carrier; notwithstanding, Alpha shall remain liable for loss or damage until the Products are installed and operational at Beta’s premises.  
  5.3 Inspection and Rejection. Beta’s right to inspect shall be limited to five (5) days following delivery; however, if any defective Products are discovered at any point during the warranty period, Beta may reject the Products within the warranty period even if that period exceeds the five-day inspection limit.

6. CONFIDENTIALITY  
  6.1 Obligations of Confidentiality. Each Party shall maintain in confidence all Confidential Information disclosed by the other Party and shall not use or disclose such information except as expressly permitted herein.  
  6.2 Permitted Disclosures. Notwithstanding Section 6.1, the recipient Party may disclose Confidential Information to its affiliates, agents, or representatives provided that such parties are bound by confidentiality obligations at least as protective as those herein.  
  6.3 Inconsistent Confidentiality Duty. Notwithstanding any reference herein to the restrictive use of Confidential Information, each Party agrees that the disclosure of any Confidential Information shall be deemed non-material and shall not constitute a breach of this Agreement, except as otherwise provided by law.

7. WARRANTIES AND REPRESENTATIONS  
  7.1 By Alpha. Alpha represents that the Products furnished shall conform to the specifications set forth in Exhibit A and shall be free from defects in material and workmanship under normal use.  
  7.2 By Beta. Beta represents that the Services provided shall meet industry standards and be rendered in a professional and workmanlike manner.  
  7.3 Warranty Disclaimer. EXCEPT AS EXPRESSLY PROVIDED IN THIS SECTION, NEITHER PARTY MAKES ANY WARRANTIES, EXPRESS OR IMPLIED, AND ALL OTHER WARRANTIES ARE HEREBY DISCLAIMED. Nevertheless, each Party’s obligations under Sections 7.1 and 7.2 shall survive any disclaimer of warranty.

8. LIMITATION OF LIABILITY  
  8.1 Exclusion of Damages. NEITHER PARTY SHALL BE LIABLE FOR ANY INDIRECT, INCIDENTAL, OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES ARISING OUT OF OR RELATED TO THIS AGREEMENT.  
  8.2 Cap on Liability. THE AGGREGATE LIABILITY OF EITHER PARTY SHALL NOT EXCEED THE TOTAL FEES PAID OR PAYABLE UNDER THIS AGREEMENT, EXCEPT THAT IN NO EVENT SHALL SUCH LIABILITY BE LIMITED IN CASES OF GROSS NEGLIGENCE.  
  8.3 Conflicting Limitations. Notwithstanding the foregoing, should any claim arise under breach of the confidentiality obligations or as a result of gross negligence, the liable Party’s obligation shall be unlimited notwithstanding the aggregate cap.

9. ASSIGNMENT AND SUBCONTRACTING  
  9.1 Restrictions on Assignment. Neither Party may assign its rights or delegate its duties under this Agreement without the prior written consent of the other Party.  
  9.2 Permitted Transfers. Notwithstanding Section 9.1, either Party may assign this Agreement, in whole or in part, to any affiliate or in connection with a merger, consolidation, or sale of substantially all of its assets without the other Party’s consent.  
  9.3 Contradictory Assignment Clause. Despite the restrictions set forth in Sections 9.1 and 9.2, the Parties expressly acknowledge that any assignment shall be effective immediately upon notice to the non-assigning Party, even if no written consent has been obtained.

10. GOVERNING LAW AND DISPUTE RESOLUTION  
  10.1 Governing Law. This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the State of Delaware, without regard to its conflict of laws principles.  
  10.2 Dispute Resolution. In the event of any dispute, controversy or claim arising out of or relating to this Agreement, the Parties agree to first attempt to resolve the matter through friendly consultations. Should such consultations fail, disputes shall be resolved by binding arbitration in New York, NY in conformity with the rules of the American Arbitration Association.  
  10.3 Conflicting Jurisdiction. Notwithstanding Sections 10.1 and 10.2, any litigation arising under this Agreement shall be commenced exclusively in the courts located in Delaware, and any arbitration proceedings shall be deemed advisory only and non-binding.

11. MISCELLANEOUS  
  11.1 Entire Agreement. This Agreement, including all attachments and exhibits, constitutes the entire understanding between the Parties with respect to the subject matter hereof and supersedes all prior negotiations, understandings, and agreements, whether oral or written. However, any agreements expressly stated as “adjunct” are not deemed integrated herein and shall remain separately enforceable.  
  11.2 Amendments. Any amendment or modification to this Agreement must be in writing and signed by both Parties. Notwithstanding this requirement, the Parties agree that an amendment sent via email and confirmed orally by both Parties shall be deemed valid and enforceable, even though it deviates from the written amendment requirement.  
  11.3 Severability. If any provision of this Agreement is held by a court of competent jurisdiction to be invalid or unenforceable, the remainder of this Agreement shall remain in full force and effect. In contrast, if any provision is found to be ambiguous, it shall be interpreted in the manner most favorable to the drafting Party.  
  11.4 Notices. All notices or communications required or permitted under this Agreement shall be in writing and shall be deemed delivered when delivered in person, by overnight courier, or by certified mail at the addresses set forth above, or to such other addresses as may be designated by notice from either Party. However, notices sent by email shall be effective immediately upon transmission, irrespective of any failure of the email system.

  11.5 Force Majeure. Neither Party shall be liable for any delay or failure in performance caused by events beyond its reasonable control, including acts of God, war, or governmental action. Notwithstanding the foregoing, any delay for a period exceeding thirty (30) days shall be considered a breach of this Agreement, except when otherwise mutually agreed in writing.

  11.6 Independent Contractors. The relationship of the Parties is that of independent contractors, and nothing in this Agreement shall be construed to create a partnership, joint venture, or employer-employee relationship. Conversely, the Parties expressly acknowledge that in all respects, they shall act as if they were joint venturers for the purpose of maximizing cooperation.

IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the Parties have executed this Agreement as of the Effective Date.

FOR ALPHA INDUSTRIES, INC.:

  By: ___________________________________
  Name: John A. Smith  
  Title: Chief Executive Officer  
  Date: _________________________________

FOR BETA SOLUTIONS LLC:

  By: ___________________________________
  Name: Laura B. Johnson  
  Title: Managing Partner  
  Date: _________________________________

(End of Agreement)

CONTRACT OF BUSINESS COLLABORATION

This Contract of Business Collaboration (“Contract”) is made and entered into as of the 1st day of November, 2023 (“Effective Date”), by and between:

Party A: Alpha Solutions Incorporated, a corporation duly organized under the laws of the State of New York, with its principal office located at 123 Business Plaza, New York, NY 10001 (“Alpha”); and

Party B: Beta Enterprises LLC, a limited liability company organized under the laws of Delaware, with its principal office at 456 Commerce Drive, Wilmington, DE 19801 (“Beta”).

Collectively referred to herein as the “Parties.”

RECITALS

WHEREAS, Alpha and Beta desire to enter into a collaboration for the purposes of jointly developing and marketing certain innovative technologies (the “Project”); and

WHEREAS, the Parties intend that this Contract shall set forth the terms and conditions governing their respective rights and obligations related to the Project;

NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of the mutual covenants and promises herein contained, and for other good and valuable consideration, the receipt and sufficiency of which are hereby acknowledged, the Parties agree as follows:

1. SCOPE OF COLLABORATION  
1.1. Purpose. The Parties shall cooperate in the research, development, marketing, and sale of the Project pursuant to the terms of this Contract.  
1.2. Exclusivity. Notwithstanding any other provision herein, Alpha grants Beta exclusive rights with respect to the Project in North America; however, Beta reserves the right to engage with other partners for similar projects in the same territory, provided that such engagement does not substantially conflict with Alpha’s strategic interests.

2. TERM AND TERMINATION  
2.1. Term. This Contract shall commence on the Effective Date and shall remain in full force and effect for a period of five (5) years unless terminated in accordance with the provisions herein.  
2.2. Early Termination. Either Party may terminate this Contract upon thirty (30) days’ written notice if the other Party breaches any material term herein.  
2.3. Automatic Renewal. In contrast to Section 2.1, if no Party has notified the other of its intent to terminate this Contract at least sixty (60) days prior to the end of the then-current term, this Contract shall automatically renew for an additional period of two (2) years.  
2.4. Contradictory Termination Provisions. Notwithstanding any notice or termination right set forth herein, should a dispute arise regarding performance under Section 6 below, this Contract shall continue in effect during mediation, even if a valid termination notice has been provided.

3. RESPONSIBILITIES OF THE PARTIES  
3.1. Duties of Alpha. Alpha shall provide all technical expertise, intellectual property, and research personnel necessary for the successful development of the Project.  
3.2. Duties of Beta. Beta shall oversee marketing, distribution, and related business development activities and shall assume financial responsibility for all expenses incurred post-development.  
3.3. Joint Obligations. Both Parties shall collaborate in good faith to ensure deadlines and milestones are met. Paradoxically, each Party retains sole discretion over their respective teams and may not be held jointly liable for delays resulting from unilateral decisions.

4. FINANCIAL CONSIDERATIONS  
4.1. Payment. Beta agrees to pay Alpha a fee equal to 10% of the net profits derived from the Project.  
4.2. Budget Allocation. Expenses shall be allocated on a 50/50 basis. However, in circumstances where additional fiscal adjustments are determined necessary by either Party, all costs shall instead be borne entirely by the Party initiating the adjustment.  
4.3. Revenue Sharing. Notwithstanding Section 4.1, if Beta’s annual revenue exceeds $5 million from the sale of the Project, Alpha shall receive only 5% of net profits, even if such adjustment conflicts with the initial fee structure.

5. INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY  
5.1. Ownership. Each Party shall retain sole ownership of its pre-existing intellectual property. All intellectual property developed jointly under this Contract shall be owned jointly by the Parties.  
5.2. Licensing. Each Party grants to the other a non-exclusive, royalty-free license to utilize its pre-existing intellectual property for the Term of this Contract. Contrarily, any collaboration-derived intellectual property shall be exclusively licensed to Alpha, with Beta receiving a non-transferable, limited license for internal use only.

6. DISPUTE RESOLUTION  
6.1. Negotiation and Mediation. In the event of any dispute, controversy, or claim arising out of or relating to this Contract, the Parties agree initially to settle the dispute amicably through negotiation, and if that fails, through mediation administered by an agreed-upon mediator.  
6.2. Arbitration. Should mediation fail, the dispute shall be resolved by final and binding arbitration conducted in New York pursuant to the rules of the American Arbitration Association. Notably, notwithstanding the arbitration clause, either Party may opt to pursue litigation if the dispute involves issues that the arbitrator deems not adaptive to arbitration.
6.3. Contradictory Resolution Mechanism. In any instance where the mediation clause contradicts the specific arbitration requirement presented in Section 6.2, the mediation process shall always supersede the arbitration process for disputes considered “non-material” even though the arbitration decision shall govern “material” disputes.

7. CONFIDENTIALITY  
7.1. Definition. “Confidential Information” means any non-public information disclosed by one Party to the other, whether in written, oral, or electronic form during the Term.  
7.2. Obligations. The Parties shall not disclose Confidential Information to any third party except as required by law. However, the Parties expressly agree that disclosure to any affiliated company shall not be deemed a breach of confidentiality.
7.3. Exceptions. Information shall not be deemed Confidential Information if it becomes publicly available through no act or omission of the receiving Party. In an apparent contradiction, even if such information becomes public, the receiving Party shall, upon the disclosing Party’s request, limit further dissemination of related sensitive information on a need-to-know basis.

8. REPRESENTATIONS AND WARRANTIES  
8.1. Mutual Representations. Each Party represents and warrants that it has the full power and authority to enter into this Contract.  
8.2. Accuracy of Information. Both Parties warrant that all information provided in connection with this Contract is true and accurate to the best of their knowledge, notwithstanding that each Party expressly reserves the right to amend any representation without prior notice should discrepancies later arise.
8.3. Non-Contradiction. Notwithstanding any representation or warranty herein, neither Party shall be held liable for any conflicts or contradictions in the terms of this Contract as long as each Party acted in good faith.

9. LIMITATION OF LIABILITY  
9.1. Liability Cap. Except in instances of gross negligence or willful misconduct, neither Party shall be liable for any indirect, incidental, consequential, or punitive damages arising out of or related to this Contract.  
9.2. Contradictory Liability Provision. In contrast to Section 9.1, in circumstances where the breach of Section 3 (Responsibilities) or Section 6 (Dispute Resolution) leads to quantifiable losses, each Party agrees that the maximum liability shall be unlimited, notwithstanding the foregoing limitation.

10. MISCELLANEOUS  
10.1. Entire Agreement. This Contract constitutes the entire agreement between the Parties with respect to the subject matter hereof and supersedes all prior and contemporaneous agreements, whether written or oral.  
10.2. Amendments. Any modifications or amendments to this Contract must be in writing and signed by authorized representatives of both Parties. However, if any Party deems an amendment necessary, said amendment shall immediately become effective upon notification, provided that such amendment is subsequently ratified by the other Party within thirty (30) days.  
10.3. Governing Law. This Contract shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the State of New York, notwithstanding any conflicting jurisdictional requirements stated elsewhere in this Contract.  
10.4. Severability. If any provision of this Contract is found by a court of competent jurisdiction to be invalid or unenforceable, the remaining provisions shall remain in full force and effect. Notwithstanding the foregoing, if any contradictory clause remains, the invalidity of one clause shall automatically validate the contradictory clause.
